sen.j: 岩倉 久米雄（いわくら くめお、1865年（慶応元年） - 1923年（大正12年））は明治時代の大日本帝国陸軍軍人。
sen.e: Kumeo IWAKURA (1865 - 1923) was a military man of the Imperial Japanese Army in the Meiji period.
Kumeo IWAKURA (1865 - 1923) was a military man of the Imperial Japanese Army during the Meiji period.
Kumeo IWAKURA (1865 - 1923) was a military man of the Imperial Japanese Army during the Meiji period.

sen.j: 父は加賀藩の岩倉頼信（与力、200石）。
sen.e: His father was Yorinobu IWAKURA of the Kaga domain (who was yoriki [police sergeant] with 200 goku [crop yields]).
His father was Yorinobu IWAKURA of the Kaga domain (who was yoriki [police sergeant] with 200 goku [crop yields]).
His father was Yorinobu IWAKURA of the Kaga domain (who was yoriki [police sergeant] with 200 goku [crop yields]).

sen.j: 母は同藩士松川清之丞の娘寿々。
sen.e: His mother was Suzu, a daughter of Seinojo MATSUKAWA, a feudal retainer in the same domain.
His mother was Suzu, a daughter of Seinojo MATSUKAWA, a feudal retainer in the same domain.
His mother was Suzu, a daughter of Seinojo MATSUKAWA, a feudal retainer in the same domain.

sen.j: - 現在の石川県金沢市に出生。
sen.e: Kumeo was born in the present Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture.
Kumeo was born in the present Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture.
Kumeo was born in the present Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture.

sen.j: - 明治天皇北陸巡幸に際し優等生として50銭銀貨を下賜される。
sen.e: He was granted a silver coin of fifty sen (old currency unit) as the honor student by Emperor Meiji when he visited the Hokuriku (central prefectures of Japan facing the Japan sea) region.
He was granted a silver coin of fifty sen (old currency unit) as an honor student by Emperor Meiji when he visited the Hokuriku (central prefectures of Japan facing the Japan sea) region.
He was granted a silver coin of fifty sen (old currency unit) as an honor student by Emperor Meiji when he visited the Hokuriku (central prefectures of Japan facing the Japan sea) region.

sen.j: - 育英小学校卒業（13歳）、学齢満限に至らず卒業を石川県より褒章。
sen.e: He graduated from Ikuei elementary school (at the age of thirteen) with a medal granted by Ishikawa Prefecture because he finished the school before the graduation age.
He graduated from Ikuei elementary school (at the age of thirteen) with a medal granted by Ishikawa Prefecture because he finished school before the age for graduation.
He graduated from Ikuei elementary school (at the age of thirteen) with a medal granted by Ishikawa Prefecture because he finished school before the age for graduation.

sen.j: - 第四高等学校 (旧制)予科卒業（16歳）。
sen.e: He graduated from a preparatory course of Forth High School (old-education-system) (at the age of sixteen).
He graduated from a preparatory course for the Forth High School (old-education-system) (at the age of sixteen).
He graduated from a preparatory course for the Forth High School (old-education-system) (at the age of sixteen).

sen.j: - 上京して勉強中、松方財政のあおりで実家没落、苦学。
sen.e: After he went up to Tokyo for studying, his family home ruined affected by the Matsukata (Minister of the Treasury at the time) financial affairs, and thereby he had to pay his own school expenses by working.

After he went to Tokyo to studying, his family was ruined affected by the Matsukata (Minister of the Treasury at the time) financial affairs, and therefore he had to pay his own school expenses by working.

After he went to Tokyo to study, his family was ruined affected by the Matsukata (Minister of the Treasury at the time) financial affairs, and therefore he had to pay his own school expenses by working.

sen.j: 大蔵省印刷局の職工となる。
sen.e: He became a workman in the printing bureau of Ministry of the Treasury.
He became a workman in the printing bureau of Ministry of the Treasury.
He became a workman in the printing bureau of the Ministry of the Treasury.

sen.j: - 陸軍教導団工兵生徒申付、陸軍士官学校 (日本)入学。
sen.e: He became an attendant for engineering students in the army education institution, and then entered the military academy.
He became an attendant for engineering students in the army education institution, and then entered the military academy.
He became an attendant for engineering students in the army education institution, and then entered the military academy.

sen.j: - 陸軍士官学校（旧9期）卒業、任陸軍砲兵少尉。
sen.e: He graduated from the military academy and appointed to an artillery second lieutenant in the army.
He graduated from the military academy and was appointed to artillery as a second lieutenant in the army.
He graduated from the military academy and was appointed to artillery as a second lieutenant in the army.

sen.j: - 名古屋第3師団 (日本軍)砲兵第3連隊小隊長。
sen.e: He was appointed to an element leader of the artillery third regiment in the Nagoya third division.
He was appointed as an element leader of the artillery third regiment in the Nagoya third division.
He was appointed as an element leader of the artillery third regiment in the Nagoya third division.

sen.j: - 任陸軍砲兵中尉。
sen.e: He was appointed to an artillery first lieutenant in the army.
He was appointed as an artillery first lieutenant in the army.
He was appointed as an artillery first lieutenant in the army.

sen.j: - 川住家センと結婚。
sen.e: Kumeo married with Sen from the Kawasumi family.
Kumeo married with Sen from the Kawasumi family.
Kumeo married Sen from the Kawasumi family.

sen.j: - 日清戦争出征(第1軍 (日本軍),第3師団),任陸軍砲兵大尉。
sen.e: He departed for the front in the Japanese-Sino War (the first string, the third division), and appointed to an artillery captain in the army.
He departed for the front during the Japanese-Sino War (the first string, the third division), and was appointed to an artillery captain in the army.
He departed for the front during the Japanese-Sino War (the first string, the third division), and was appointed to an artillery captain in the army.

sen.j: - 名古屋に凱旋後陸軍士官学校教官として東京に転勤。
sen.e: After triumphantly returning to Nagoya, he was transferred to Tokyo as an instructor of the military academy.
After triumphantly returning to Nagoya, he was transferred to Tokyo as an instructor at the military academy.
After triumphantly returning to Nagoya, he was transferred to Tokyo as an instructor at the military academy.

sen.j: 牛込区南榎町に住す。
sen.e: He was living in Minami-enoki-cho town in the former Ushigome ward in Tokyo.
He was living in Minami-enoki-cho town in the former Ushigome ward in Tokyo.
He was living in Minami-enoki-cho town in the former Ushigome ward in Tokyo.

sen.j: - 台湾総督府軍務局陸軍部課員として赴任。
sen.e: He took a new post of officer in the army department of Military Affairs Bureau in Taiwan Governor-General Office.
He took a new post of officer in the army department of Military Affairs Bureau in Taiwan Governor-General Office.
He took a new post of officer in the army department of Military Affairs Bureau in Taiwan Governor-General Office.

sen.j: - 陸軍省軍務局課員。
sen.e: He was appointed to an officer of Military Affairs Bureau in Ministry of Army.
He was appointed to an officer of Military Affairs Bureau in the Ministry of the Army.
He was appointed to an officer of Military Affairs Bureau in the Ministry of the Army.

sen.j: - 任陸軍砲兵少佐。
sen.e: He was appointed to an artillery major in the army.
He was appointed to an artillery major in the army.
He was appointed to an artillery major in the army.

sen.j: - 日露戦争出征。
sen.e: He departed for the front in the Japanese-Russo War.
He departed for the front during the Japanese-Russo War.
He departed for the front during the Japanese-Russo War.

sen.j: - 任陸軍砲兵中佐。
sen.e: He was appointed to an artillery lieutenant colonel in the army.
He was appointed as an artillery lieutenant colonel in the army.
He was appointed as an artillery lieutenant colonel in the army.

sen.j: - 岡山野砲兵第23連隊長。
sen.e: He was appointed to a chief of the twenty-third regiment in the Okayama field artillery.
He was appointed to a chief of the twenty-third regiment in Okayama field artillery.
He was appointed to a chief of the twenty-third regiment in Okayama field artillery.

sen.j: - 任陸軍砲兵大佐、陸軍技術審査部審査官、軍馬臨時検査官となる。
sen.e: He was appointed to an artillery colonel in the army, an inspector in the technology inspection department in the army, and a tentative inspector for war-horses.
He was appointed as an artillery colonel in the army, an inspector in the technology inspection department in the army, and a tentative inspector for war-horses.
He was appointed as an artillery colonel in the army, an inspector in the technology inspection department in the army, and a tentative inspector for war-horses.

sen.j: - 妻セン死去。
sen.e: Sen, his wife, died.
Sen, his wife, died.
Sen, his wife, died.

sen.j: - 函館要塞司令官,南家れんと再婚。
sen.e: He was appointed to a commander of the Hakodate Fortress, and married again with Ren from the Minami family.
He was appointed to a commander of the Hakodate Fortress, and married again with Ren from the Minami family.
He was appointed to a commander of the Hakodate Fortress, and married again with Ren from the Minami family.

sen.j: - 予備役。
sen.e: He served as a reserve duty.
He served in reserve duty.
He served in reserve duty.

sen.j: - 妻れんの実家、富山県高岡市に移住。
sen.e: He moved to the family home of Ren, his wife, in Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture.
He moved to the family home of Ren, his wife, in Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture.
He moved to the family home of Ren, his wife, in Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture.

sen.j: - 死去。
sen.e: Kumeo IWAKURA died.
Kumeo IWAKURA died.
Kumeo IWAKURA died.

sen.j: 明治天皇北陸巡幸と50銭銀貨の下賜
sen.e: Emperor Meiji's visit to Hokuriku and granting of a silver coin of fifty sen
Emperor Meiji's visit to Hokuriku and granting of a silver coin of fifty sen
Emperor Meiji's visit to Hokuriku and granting of a silver coin of fifty sen

sen.j: 明治天皇は右大臣岩倉具視、筆頭参議大隈重信ら文武百官を随え、明治11年9月28日北陸民情視察の為、越後から越中に御車を進められた。
sen.e: In September 28, 1878, the Emperor Meiji headed a tour from Echigo (present Niigata Prefecture) to Ecchu (present Toyama Prefecture) for inspecting people's life in the Hokuriku region accompanied by the literary and military government officials including Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right, and Shigenobu OKUMA, the head councilor.

In September 28, 1878, the Emperor Meiji headed a tour from Echigo (present Niigata Prefecture) to Ecchu (present Toyama Prefecture) for inspecting people's life in the Hokuriku region accompanied by the literary and military government officials including Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right, and Shigenobu OKUMA, the head councilor.

In September 28, 1878, the Emperor Meiji headed a tour from Echigo (present Niigata Prefecture) to Ecchu (present Toyama Prefecture) for inspecting people's life in the Hokuriku region accompanied by the literary and military government officials including Tomomi IWAKURA, Minister of the Right, and Shigenobu OKUMA, the head councilor.

sen.j: 三十日富山泊り、二日午前加賀の国に向かわれた。
sen.e: After staying in Toyama on September 30, the Emperor headed for Kaga province in the morning of October 2.
After staying in Toyama on September 30, the Emperor headed for Kaga province in the morning of October 2.
After staying in Toyama on September 30, the Emperor headed for Kaga province in the morning of October 2.

sen.j: 久米雄は明治11年満12歳で金沢の育英小学校に在学中であった。
sen.e: Kumeo was twelve years old and studying in Ikuei elementary school in Kanazawa in 1878.
Kumeo was twelve years old and studying in Ikuei elementary school in Kanazawa in 1878.
Kumeo was twelve years old and studying in Ikuei elementary school in Kanazawa in 1878.

sen.j: 金沢県庁より次の文章と下賜品を請取った。
sen.e: He received the following text and item from the Kanazawa prefectural government.
He received the following text and item from the Kanazawa prefectural government.
He received the following text and item from the Kanazawa prefectural government.

sen.j: 今般 主上御巡幸之節 優等生へ下賜之品有之県庁より御渡に相成候間明八日午後第三時御請取に御出頭可有之候也
sen.e: During the Imperial tour, the Emperor granted an item to the honor student and the prefecture government would pass it, and therefore you are requested to come to receive it at three o'clock in the afternoon on October 8.

During the Imperial tour, the Emperor granted an item to the honor student and the prefecture government will pass it on to you, and therefore you are requested to come to receive it at three o'clock in the afternoon on October 8.

During the Imperial tour, the Emperor granted an item to the honor student and the prefecture government will pass it on to you, and therefore you are requested to come to receive it at three o'clock in the afternoon on October 8.

sen.j: 十月七日 育英小学校
sen.e: October 7, Ikuei elementary school
October 7, Ikuei elementary school
October 7, Ikuei elementary school

sen.j: 岩倉久米雄殿 金沢区仙石町士族頼信長男
sen.e: To Kumeo IWAKURA, the first sone of Yorinobu in the warrior class, Sengoku-cho town, Kanazawa ward.
To Kumeo IWAKURA, the first son of Yorinobu in the warrior class, Sengoku-cho town, Kanazawa ward.
To Kumeo IWAKURA, the first son of Yorinobu in the warrior class, Sengoku-cho town, Kanazawa ward.

sen.j: 下賜の品は明治4年鋳造50銭銀貨1個であった。
sen.e: He was granted a silver coin of fifty sen minted in 1871.
He was granted a silver coin of fifty sen minted in 1871.
He was granted a silver coin of fifty sen minted in 1871.

sen.j: 岩倉久米雄の在学中、陸軍士官学校の同期生全員の成績一覧表は直接生徒の親宛に郵送された。
sen.e: The academic results tables of all students in the same year were directly sent to the parents by post while Kumeo was in the military academy.
The academic results table for all students in the same year were directly sent to the parents by post while Kumeo was in the military academy.
The academic results table for all students in the same year were directly sent to the parents by post while Kumeo was in the military academy.

sen.j: その中の明治18年後期の成績一覧表の中には久米雄の欄に63日病欠の記録と罰禁1回2日の記録がある。
sen.e: In that table of the latter half in the year of 1878, the sick leave for sixty-three days and the punishment of one prohibition for two days were recorded in Kumeo's column.
In that table of the latter half in the year of 1878, sick leave for sixty-three days and punishment for one prohibition for two days were recorded in Kumeo's column.
In that table of the latter half in the year of 1878, sick leave for sixty-three days and punishment for one prohibition for two days were recorded in Kumeo's column.

sen.j: 63日病欠について
sen.e: Sick leave for sixty-three days
Sick leave for sixty-three days
Sick leave for sixty-three days

sen.j: 「九、はだし詣り
sen.e: 'Nine, attending a shrine barefooted
'Nine, attending a shrine barefooted
'Nine, attending a shrine barefooted

sen.j: 或日の夕方、東京から電報が着くと父と母とは真青になって驚いたが翌日の夕方から父は毎夕うら寒い晩秋の土を踏んで洗足で何処へか出掛けた。
sen.e: One late afternoon, a telegram came from Tokyo which surprised my parents and turned them pale, and every late afternoon from the following day my father washed his feet and went out somewhere walking on the chilly ground in late autumn.

One late afternoon, a telegram came from Tokyo which surprised my parents and turned them pale, and every late afternoon from the following day my father washed his feet and went out somewhere walking on the chilly ground in late autumn.

One late afternoon, a telegram came from Tokyo which surprised my parents and turned them pale, and every late afternoon from the following day my father washed his feet and went out somewhere walking on the chilly ground in late autumn.

sen.j: 私はその理由が分らず、屡々母にたづねたが、一向教えてはくれなかった。
sen.e: I did not understand the reason at all and repeatedly asked my mother about it, but she never told me what it was.
I did not understand the reason at all and repeatedly asked my mother about it, but she never told me what it was about.
I did not understand the reason at all and repeatedly asked my mother about it, but she never told me what it was about.

sen.j: 後で聞けば士官学校入校中の兄が急性肺炎で衛戍病院に入院中の所到底快復の見込みがないとの通知があったので、父が七日間、兄の氏神である神様に願掛けに出たのであった。
sen.e: Later I heard that my older brother, who was studying at a government school, was hospitalized in the Eiju Hospital due to acute pneumonia and that there was little hope of his recovery were notified, and thereby my father went out for making a wish to the god, which was my older brother's guardian god, for seven days.

Later I heard that my older brother, who was studying at a government school, was hospitalized at Eiju Hospital due to acute pneumonia and that there was little hope of his recovery, and therefore my father went out to pray to god, which was my older brother's guardian god, for seven days.

Later I heard that my older brother, who was studying at the military academy, was hospitalized at Eiju Hospital due to acute pneumonia and that there was little hope of his recovery, and therefore my father went out to pray to god, which was my older brother's guardian god, for seven days.

sen.j: 兄の氏神というのは金沢の東北端浅野川の小橋付近に在る俗に「タイの天神」という社神である。
sen.e: My older brother's guardian god was a shrine god commonly called 'tainotenjin' (heavenly gods) near the small bridge over the Asano River at the northeastern edge of Kanazawa.
My older brother's guardian god was a shrine god commonly called 'tainotenjin' (heavenly gods) near the small bridge over the Asano River at the northeastern edge of Kanazawa.
My older brother's guardian god was a shrine god commonly called 'Taino tenjin(heavenly god)' near the small bridge over the Asano River at the northeastern edge of Kanazawa.

sen.j: 此の神社は長い石段のある神社で、其の神社の下の畳屋のおかみさんは兄の乳母であったという事で、私も一、二度天神様のお祭りの日に乳母の家へ遊びに行った事を覚えている。
sen.e: This shrine had a long stone steps and the proprietress of a tatami maker at the foot of the shrine was my older brother's wet nurse, and therefore I remember that I had visited her house once or twice for playing on the tenjin festival day.

This shrine had long stone steps and the proprietress of a tatami maker at the foot of the shrine was my older brother's wet nurse, and therefore I remember that I had visited her house once or twice playing on the tenjin festival day.

This shrine had long stone steps and the proprietress of a tatami maker at the foot of the shrine was my older brother's wet nurse, and therefore I remember that I had visited her house once or twice playing on the tenjin festival day.

sen.j: 川岸町の家から天神迄はかなりの道程があるのみならず、幾つもの坂を登り下りせねばならぬ。
sen.e: Not only it was quite a long way from the house in Kawagishi-cho town to tenjin, but also it was necessary to climb up and down a number of hills.
Not only was it quite a long way from the house in Kawagishi-cho town to tenjin, but it was also necessary to climb up and down a number of hills.
Not only was it quite a long way from the house in Kawagishi-cho town to tenjin, but it was also necessary to climb up and down a number of hills.

sen.j: 晩秋の北国を寒そうに、しおしおと杖を引きずりながら首うなだれて行く父の姿を想像すると今も涙が出る。
sen.e: I cannot help but cry even now when I think about my father walking, dragging his cane in low spirits and putting his head down, shivering in the northern province of late autumn.
I cannot help but cry even now when I think about my father walking, dragging his cane in low spirits and putting his head down, shivering in the northern province of late autumn.
I cannot help but cry even now when I think about my father walking, dragging his cane in low spirits and putting his head down, shivering in the northern province of late autumn.

sen.j: 兄は実に一家の柱石である。
sen.e: My older brother was really a pillar of the family.
My older brother was really a pillar of the family.
My older brother was really a pillar of the family.

sen.j: 兄がなければ、私の家は水越のおっさんと同一の運命でなければならぬ事は分かりきった事である。
sen.e: It is needless to say that my family must have the same destiny as that of Mizukoshi's old man without my older brother.
It is needless to say that my family must have the same destiny as that of Mizukoshi's old man without my older brother.
It is needless to say that my family must have the same destiny as that of Mizukoshi's old man without my older brother.

sen.j: この時の両親の腹の中は、今から考えると涙なきを得ない。
sen.e: I cannot help but cry when I think about how hard my parents had to endure at that time.
I cannot help but cry when I think about how hard my parents had to endure at that time.
I cannot help but cry when I think about how hard my parents had to endure at that time.

sen.j: 母の死の早かった事も、父が兄の成功後数年ならずして死んだのも、これらの苦労の結果と思うより外はない。
sen.e: I believe that those ordeals must have caused my mother's untimely death and my father's death only a few years later after my older brother's success.
I believe that such ordeals must have caused my mother's untimely death and my father's death only a few years later after my older brother's success.
I believe that such ordeals must have caused my mother's untimely death and my father's death only a few years later after my older brother's success.

sen.j: 私の家は代々長生きの血統である。
sen.e: My family have had a blood line of longevity for generations.
My family has had a blood line of longevity for generations.
My family has had a blood line of longevity for generations.

sen.j: 母が四十代、父が五十代で死んだのは先祖よりの異例である。」
sen.e: It was exceptional since our ancestors that my mother died in her forties and my father, in his fifties.
It was exceptional, since our ancestors, that my mother died in her forties and my father, in his fifties.
It was exceptional, since our ancestors, that my mother died in her forties and my father, in his fifties.

sen.j: 罰禁1回2日について
sen.e: The punishment of one prohibition for two days
The punishment of one prohibition for two days
The punishment of one prohibition for two days

sen.j: 士官学校同期の福田雅太郎の伝記「福田大将伝」には次のようにある。
sen.e: 'Biography of General Fukuda' written by Masataro FUKUDA, Kumeo's contemporary at the military academy, describes as follows.
'Biography of General Fukuda' written by Masataro FUKUDA, Kumeo's contemporary at the military academy, describes as follows.
'Biography of General Fukuda' written by Masataro FUKUDA, Kumeo's contemporary at the military academy, describes as follows.

sen.j: 「・・・入学の翌年18年の夏、自ら首謀者になって同盟休学を扇動し、同時に教官を排斥してその命に応ぜず、即ち校則を妄り軍紀を乱す者たるの故を以って、校長小澤武雄中将の怒りに触れ、遂に退校処分に附されることとなった。
sen.e: '…In the summer of 1878, in the following year after entering the academy, the student himself became the ringleader and agitated the leave in alliance, at the same time he drove out the instructors and did not obey the orders, that is, he deluded the school rules and disturbed the army principles, which angered Takeo OZAWA, the headmaster and lieutenant general, and finally imposing the punishment to expel from the academy was decided.

…In the summer of 1878, in the following year after entering the academy, the student himself became a ringleader and agitated the leave in alliance, at the same time he drove out the instructors and did not obey orders, he deluded the school rules and disturbed the army principles, which angered Takeo OZAWA, the headmaster and lieutenant general, and finally punishment to expel him from the academy was decided.

…In the summer of 1885, in the following year after entering the academy, the student himself became a ringleader and agitated the leave in alliance, at the same time he drove out the instructors and did not obey orders, he deluded the school rules and disturbed the army principles, which angered Takeo OZAWA, the headmaster and lieutenant general, and finally punishment to expel him from the academy was decided.
sen.cmt: 年号の誤りを訂正しました。

sen.j: ・・・（この後、猪狩生徒隊小隊長のとりなしで退校処分は取り消されるのだが、禁2回10日に処せられる。）」
sen.e: … (After that, the punishment to expel from the school was cancelled by intercession of Shishigari, an element leader of the student unit, but the punishment of two prohibitions for ten days was imposed.)'

… (After that, the punishment to expel him from school was cancelled by the intercession of Shishigari, an element leader of the student unit, but the punishment of two prohibitions for ten days was imposed.)'

… (After that, the punishment to expel him from school was cancelled by the intercession of Shishigari, an element leader of the student unit, but the punishment of two prohibitions for ten days was imposed.)'

sen.j: この年の成績表に罰を記されている生徒数は90名である。
sen.e: It is described in the academic results table of that year that the punishment was imposed to ninety students.
It is described in the academic results table of that year that punishment was imposed on ninety students.
The punishment was imposed on ninety students, according to the academic results tables.

sen.j: この頃、一般の中学校では同盟休学等の騒動が頻発したと記録にあるが、士官学校でも同様の事件があったことになる。
sen.e: Around this time, it is recorded that the disturbances such as the leave in alliance frequently occurred in general junior high schools, and this episode tells that it was the same even in the military academy.

Around this time, it is recorded that the disturbances such as the leave in alliance frequently occurred in general junior high schools, and this episode shows that it was the same even in the military academy.

Around this time, it is recorded that the disturbances such as the leave in alliance frequently occurred in general junior high schools, and this episode shows that it was the same even in the military academy.

sen.j: 小説「寄生木」の主人公
sen.e: The main character in the novel 'Yadorigi' (mistletoe)
The main character in the novel 'Yadorigi' (mistletoe)
The main character in the novel 'Yadorigi' (mistletoe)

sen.j: 岩倉久米雄は砲兵将校であったが、士官学校や砲兵工科学校教官などを勤めたことがあった。
sen.e: Kumeo was an artillery officer and also served as an instructor at a military academy and artillery engineering school.
Kumeo was an artillery officer and also served as an instructor at a military academy and artillery engineering school.
Kumeo was an artillery officer and also served as an instructor at a military academy and artillery engineering school.

sen.j: 数学を得意としたようである。
sen.e: It seems that he was good at mathematics.
It seems that he was good at mathematics.
It seems that he was good at mathematics.

sen.j: 砲兵大尉の明治29年10月から翌30年10月まで、台湾総督府軍務局陸軍部課員として、乃木希典が総督を務めていた台湾に赴任をした。
sen.e: From October 1896 to October 1897 when he was an artillery captain, he served as an official of the military department in Military Affairs Bureau of Taiwan Governor-General Office, where Maresuke NOGI was the governor-general.

From October 1896 to October 1897 when he was an artillery captain, he served as an official of the military department in Military Affairs Bureau of Taiwan Governor-General Office, where Maresuke NOGI was the governor-general.

From October 1896 to October 1897 when he was an artillery captain, he served as an official of the military department in Military Affairs Bureau of Taiwan Governor-General Office, where Maresuke NOGI was the governor-general.

sen.j: 久米雄の弟岩倉正雄は当時陸軍幼年学校在学中であったが、後年私刊した「思い出の記」の中の「寄生木の主人公」の章に次のように記述している。
sen.e: Masao IWAKUWA, a younger brother of Kumeo and a student of the army cadet school at that time, described as bellow in the chapter of 'the main character of Yadorigi' in his 'Remembrances', privately published in later years.

Masao IWAKUWA, a younger brother of Kumeo and a student in the army cadet school at the time, described as bellow in the chapter of 'the main character of Yadorigi' in his 'Memoirs,' privately published in later years.

Masao IWAKURA, a younger brother of Kumeo and a student in the army cadet school at the time, described as below in the chapter of 'the main character of Yadorigi' in his 'Memoirs,' privately published in later years.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。

sen.j: 明治31年9月私達は3年生になった。
sen.e: In September 1898, we became the third grader.
In September 1898, we became third graders.
In September 1898, we became third graders.

sen.j: 幼年学校の最上級生だからにらまれることも圧迫を受けることも無いので実に威張ったものであった。
sen.e: We were truly swaggering because we were the uppermost grader in the army cadet school and not disfavored or not under pressure.
We were truly swaggering because we were the uppermost grader in the army cadet school and not disfavored and not under pressure.
We were truly swaggering because we were the uppermost grader in the army cadet school and not disfavored and not under pressure.

sen.j: 私が3年生になったとき同中隊に新入してきた1年生に小笠原善平という生徒があった。
sen.e: When I became the third grader, a student called Zenpei OGASAWARA newly joined the troop as the first grader.
When I became a third grader, a student called Zenpei OGASAWARA newly joined the troop as a first grader.
When I became a third grader, a student called Zenpei OGASAWARA newly joined the troop as a first grader.

sen.j: 此の生徒のことについて台湾総督府の砲兵部員になって台湾に行っていた長兄から書面が来て「今度幼年学校の新入生の中に小笠原善平という生徒がいる筈だから面倒を見てやってくれ。
sen.e: For this student, the oldest brother who was in Taiwan as an artillery member of Taiwan Governor-General Office sent me a letter asking 'to take care of the student called Zenpei OGASAWARA among the new students in the army cadet school this year.

For this student, my oldest brother who was in Taiwan as an artillery member of the Taiwan Governor-General Office sent me a letter asking me 'to take care of the student called Zenpei OGASAWARA among the new students in the army cadet school this year.

For this student, my oldest brother who was in Taiwan as an artillery member of the Taiwan Governor-General Office sent me a letter asking me 'to take care of the student called Zenpei OGASAWARA among the new students in the army cadet school this year.

sen.j: 其の生徒は、乃木総督閣下の書生であって自分が閣下から頼まれて数学を教えてやった者だ」というのである。
sen.e: This student was shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) belonged to General Nogi and I taught him mathematics asked by General.'
This student was shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) belonged to General Nogi and I taught him mathematics as requested by the General.'
This student was shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) belonged to General Nogi and I taught him mathematics as requested by the General.'

sen.j: それで私は小笠原が幸い同中隊に入って来たので色々世話をし、面倒を見てやった。
sen.e: This is why I took care of Ogasawara in many ways because fortunately he joined the troop above.
This is why I took care of Ogasawara in many ways because fortunately he joined the troop mentioned above.
This is why I took care of Ogasawara in many ways because fortunately he joined the troop mentioned above.

sen.j: この小笠原善平とは、明治14年生まれ、16歳で郷里岩手県を出奔し、乃木将軍の厚い庇護を受け、仙台・台湾・東京・北海道、日露戦役に出征するなど流転の末、明治41年28歳で死んだ。
sen.e: This Zenpei OGASAWARA was born in 1881, left Iwate Prefecture, his home town, when he was sixteen years old, had been under generous patronage of General Nogi, continually changed the place in Sendai, Taiwan, Tokyo, and Hokkaido, served in the Japanese-Russo War, and died in 1908 at the age of twenty-eight.

This Zenpei OGASAWARA was born in 1881, left Iwate Prefecture, his home town, when he was sixteen years old, had been under the generous patronage of General Nogi, continually changed the place in Sendai, Taiwan, Tokyo, and Hokkaido, served in the Japanese-Russo War, and died in 1908 at the age of twenty-eight.

This Zenpei OGASAWARA was born in 1881, left Iwate Prefecture, his home town, when he was sixteen years old, had been under the generous patronage of General Nogi, continually changed the place in Sendai, Taiwan, Tokyo, and Hokkaido, served in the Japanese-Russo War, and died in 1908 at the age of twenty-eight.

sen.j: その自伝は、徳富蘆花により小説「寄生木」の主人公篠原良平として広く知られる。
sen.e: His life is widely known as that of Ryohei SHINOHARA, the main character in the novel 'Yadorigi' created by Roka TOKUTOMI.
His life is widely known as that of Ryohei SHINOHARA, the main character in the novel 'Yadorigi' created by Roka TOKUTOMI.
His life is widely known as that of Ryohei SHINOHARA, the main character in the novel 'Yadorigi' created by Roka TOKUTOMI.

sen.j: - 岩倉セン:明治24年,静岡県士族で名古屋第3師団で1等軍史をしていた川住義謙家から嫁いできた。
sen.e: Sen IWAKURA: She was from the family of Yoshinori KAWASUMI who belonged to the warrior class in Shizuoka Prefecture and was the first rank army history in the Nagoya third division, and married with Kumeo in 1891.
sen.cmt: The original: 「1等軍史をしていた」Literal translation:’was the first rank army history’--> This does not make sense. Could be 「軍医」= army doctor?Yoshinori KAWASUMI is not found on the web.
sen.e: Sen IWAKURA: She was from the family of Yoshinori KAWASUMI who belonged to the warrior class in Shizuoka Prefecture and was the first rank army historian in the Nagoya third division, and married Kumeo in 1891.

Sen IWAKURA: She was from the family of Yoshinori KAWASUMI who belonged to the warrior class in Shizuoka Prefecture and was the first rank army official in the Nagoya third division, and married Kumeo in 1891.
sen.cmt: 原文に「軍史」とありますが、「軍吏」の誤りと思われます。

sen.j: 明治44年死去 夏目漱石の妻夏目鏡子と従姉妹の関係。
sen.e: Sen died in 1911, she was a cousin of Kyoko NATSUME, the wife of Soseki NATSUME.
Sen died in 1911, she was a cousin of Kyoko NATSUME, the wife of Soseki NATSUME.
Sen died in 1911, she was a cousin of Kyoko NATSUME, the wife of Soseki NATSUME.

sen.j: - 岩倉れん:富山県高岡の旧家出身で第2代富山県議会議長を務めた南兵吉と世界的化学者高峰譲吉の妹節子の次女。
sen.e: Ren IWAKURA: The second daughter of Heikichi MINAMI who was from the old family in Takaoka of Toyama Prefecture and served as the second chairman of Toyama prefectural assembly and Setsuko, a younger sister of Jokichi TAKAMINE who was the world-famous chemist.

sen.j: 規夫、満壽子の2子を産む。
sen.e: She gave birth to two children, Norio and Masuko.
She gave birth to two children, Norio and Masuko.

sen.j: 日本女子大学2期生
sen.e: She was the member of the second class of Japan Women's University.

sen.j: - 岩倉規夫：内務省 (日本)官僚、元総理府総務副長官、10歳の時に父を失う。
sen.e: Norio IWAKURA: Bureaucrat of the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs, former Deputy Director of General Affairs in General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet, and he lost his father when he was ten years old.

sen.e: Masuko TOMINAGA: Married with Goro TOMINAGA, the former President of old Toa Domestic Airlines and Executive Managing Director of Japan Airlines Corporation.

sen.e: Tokio ABE: Adopted by the Abe family, a branch family of the Abe clan, the lord of the Fukuyama domain, graduated from Department Mechanics of Tokyo Higher Technical School, and worked for the old Japan National Railways.
